Text: Which of the following is NOT a feature of OOP?
Which OOP principle allows an object to take on multiple forms?
Which OOP principle allows hiding implementation details?
What is a constructor in C++?
Options: A special method for initializing objects|A method to destroy objects|A method to declare variables|A method to display output

Text: What is the purpose of the 'this' pointer in C++?
Options: To refer to the current object|To store a pointer to a member variable|To create a new object|To delete an object

Text: What is polymorphism in OOP?
Options: Objects taking multiple forms|Objects hiding data|Objects inheriting properties|Objects using multiple classes

Text: What is a virtual function?
Options: A function that can be overridden in derived classes|A function that cannot be overridden|A function without any implementation|A function used for destructors

Text: What is an abstract class?
Options: A class that cannot be instantiated|A class with no methods|A class with only private methods|A class with no data members

Text: What is the purpose of encapsulation?
Options: To hide the internal state and protect the data|To allow inheritance|To implement polymorphism|To provide abstraction
